My brother, when he was 16, was going to lagoon with his two best friends and he was playing this song in the bus. He said that he would like this song to be played on his funeral one day. The same day, few hours later, he tragically drowned in the lagoon. The song was played on his funeral, like he wished to (unconsciously not knowing what was going to happen...). He was a very big fan of Depeche Mode and we buried him with an album of them and his headphones too. It was in August last year. We will never forget him and this song will be always with us, for the rest of our lives. For us, the lyrics are definitely not about drugs - they are about that one day and his feelings....

Blake Voss has the voice of a 80's Dark Angel, that particular quality that made little Goth-girl's hearts skip a beat. His vocals are a superior blending of: A Robert Smith quirky darkness; The depth of the "King of Goth's" with Peter Murphy; And the confident swagger of David Bowie who embodied the pure definition of "kewl" as these men were considered a paragon of perfection. They didn't "try" to sing....!!!! No-way they were just being themselves â€• I feel Blake Voss could become today's icon.

The other half of Vandal Moon's duo, stands Jeremy Einsiedler, whose obviously a synth-virtuoso with a mastery of sounds so clearly familiar to myself, yet refreshingly expressed. A younger generation will call this music Dark Retro New-wave, Nu-Romanticism, Dark Synth-wave, or even perhaps Future-wave because of its timeless quality â€• For those of us who spent our youth listening to "New-Wave" music for the first time around the block, it's been a desperately needed respite from the shackles of Gangster-Rap, Hip-Hop, and the endlessness vocal gymnastic stylings of R&B, which all began in the 80's but never died. As someone who works within the music industry, Vandal Moon has remembered to use those old analogue synthesizers (which are worth a fortune now), because they have a warmth to the ear without the brashness new synths often have. Voss's vocal overlays are a sublime textural methodology which everyone seemed to have forgotten until Retro New-wave began gaining a foothold, but this isn't like the "Second British Invasion" of the 80's, although Voss has managed to sneak in a very slight Brit-pop flare. It's a particular vocal withholding singers sometimes use as a breathing technique, with an ever so sensitive inhale through the nose.

Even though I dislike comparisons, but if I were forced to make any comparisons, then they have every-bit of a special brew of the Information Society, Modern English, The Cure, Human League, Echo and the Bunnymen, New Order, Clan of Xymox and so many more that would overwhelm this mini-review. I sincerely hope Vandal Moon is prepared for a multi-generational following which would ring so true when on tour â€• Newbie Dark Synth-Wave, Retro New-wave, and even some Kewl Goth-kyds (both youthful and the elder-statesmen) will be standing in the same queue as Mom and Dad, as well as perhaps your Grand-mother and Grand-father (if you started your family early) but in any case kids, forget them dropping you off at the curbside.

Prepare for an ocean of people dressed in all black, except some may naturally have salt-and-pepper color hair. It's a good thing I still have my steel-toe combat-boots just for these occasions. This could be the start of something, that our global community has never seen before, a fully Multi-Generational Cross-Cultural Live Audience (MG-CC-LA) attending Vandal Moon concerts. This is quite the eye-opener for a completely new millennium.

Sorry I'm only commenting now, but better late than never. What can I say about this great band. First of all, they are (in my opinion) the best and most innovative band there is now when it comes to this style of music. Madeleine Liljestam you are simply fantastic, sensual, bewitching, beautiful, with a wonderful voice you know how to best interpret the songs you sing, with professionalism and with an uncommon grace. ELEINE, the seductive and dark side of symphonic heavy metal, probably one of the best bands I've listened to over the years in this genre. (ENEMIES) is a wonderful and compelling song, with a wonderful symphony that drags you from start to finish.Ultimately ELEINE is more than original as an active band for this genre (Fascinating, Seducete, Dark, Sinically perfect) which strikes the listener with a huge sense of wonder and originality.Honor to merit, we are only at the beginning of this great band, which over time will reserve us several tricks up its sleeve that will make those who love this musical genre happy. It doesn't matter who you are or where you are from, music erases these barriers and brings us together on a more human level. She gazed upon her lover's still face
What was full of life is now blank and cold
She gazed upon her empty house
What was once young is now lonely and old

She grabs her cloak, fighting back tears
And flees to somewhere far away
Where she can escape her fear and sorrow
But as she stops, she knows it's there to stay

Only then does she tilt her face to the sky
Her face damp and streaked from tears
Choking back on a sob she faces the moon
To which she wails out all her fears

Never does she receive a response
From the still, blankly cold moon
What was once her life was whisked away
What was once happy ended so soon

She wishes to hear her name again
Spoken softly on her lover's tongue
Never again will she feel such embrace
She tries to remember what was once sung

Luna, my love, Luna my dear
Tell me you will always be near
For I am the sky, and you are my stars
Look to the moon, I will never be far

songs.song: Forgive Me - Emotional Vocal R&B Beat Mix
songs.comment_text:
My dear friend, why must your heart be like stones
We still have much to do yet
My heart aches, as well as my weary bones
My dear friend, I pray must you not forget

The good times well spent, the good memories remember
Moments came and went, from January to December

There were tears of joy, 
There were tears of gladness
There were times we'd like to destroy
There were times of madness

Even through storms, we made it through
We stuck it together, me and you

My dear friend, why did you leave
Was it something I said or would do
Please tell me, I will believe
Let me fix this problem just for you

Don't let this friendship die, it will break my heart
For my sake, please don't lie, it may tear us apart

But now I can see it clearly
Why you couldn't tell
It was your illness making you weary
You don't look nor feel well

My dear friend, I'm such a fool
To hell you had to descend, while my body, kept cool

Had I'd known about this, you being pained
Surely, I would have done something
If told sooner, again happiness you'd have gained
In my ignorance, I've done nothing

So here I am pondering,
As I stand here under the gloomy skies, 
Sorrowful as can be...

My dear departed friend I'm wondering, 
With many tears in my eyes, 
Can you ever forgive me...?

"Now listen here my boy, There are two wolves that live inside us, constantly fighting. One represents Life, Love, family, and selflessness. The other represents Death, hate, anger and selfishness."

"Which one wins grandpa?"

"The one you feed my boy"

Icy glare it's petals dance,
Its deadly touch would leave a trance.
Its firmness softness, its spiky thorn,
Would send a chilling, relentless mourn.
Oh how I feel, the touch of grace,
To emerge myself, from inner place.
Where I cannot move, I froze with fear,
To found myself standing, upon the sphere.

In the darkness of the night
Not a star does shine in sight
Without hope, filled with plight
It's in this silence that we fly

Through the cold and bitter air
Filled with longing, alone we roam
Seeking, hoping, we pray to find
A place to call forever home

Alas, but Fate is cruel
For in this tale we are the fools
Whatever we wish, wherever we search
Never will we find a ledge to perch

Yet tired and beaten, still we try
Flying through shadow, looking for light
Till we drop like angels on high
Into the darkness of forever night
This song is both beautiful & sad. This piece is a true work of wonder. every note is delicate, graceful & sad. The composer put his heart to every note as though you can feel his pain.

I don't think the composer intended for people to talk about depression, suicide or death in regards to his/ her music. I'd rather think that they intended people to appreciate the depth and intricacy of the music created. What I feel with this music can only be defined as a beautiful sadness, something that has the listener reminisce of something that was lost (innocence, naivety or someoneÂ they loved), but also tells to remember that what we felt was real and worth the pain it may or may have caused. Or simply 'Is better to haveÂ love and lost, then to never love at all'.

My boyfriend recovered last week, he was in coma for almost 2 years, in all these years, I have only prayed to god to recover him, and last week was like a miracle in my life, he proposed me yesterday and I wanted a perfect music to play in my wedding and when I found this, this just reflected our story so I'm getting married next month and we'll play this in our wedding, pray for us

songs.song: Musician Intros - Live At The Greek Theatre, Los Angeles/1972
songs.comment_text:
â€œI consider everything that happened to be precious moments of my life.
The pain.
The suffering.
The funâ€¦
And I am here right now, because everyone was there for me. I couldnâ€™t have accomplished anything by standing still, without anybodyâ€™s help. I treasure every moment I have spent here. Unlucky? I feel pretty lucky.

This is my resolve.â€

Life, confused as this young thing shuttered at the look of death asked, "Death . . . why do people fear you, but cling to me?"

Death responded in his usual monotone manner, "Because they have known you, they have grown with you . . . but me . . . they have only heard of me, seen me only when the ones they loved disappeared in my embrace.

Though you are harder on them, making them push just to get so little they still fear me . . .

But no matter how much they fear me when the time comes, I accept them with open arms as if we where old friends."

As much as I love Scabbia and Simons I have to admit Floor is the best female voice in metal ( in my opinion ). She could sing absolutely everything, both in rock and classical manner. Add the incredible presence on stage and you have the ideal vocalist.

Keep my secret deep within,
Hear my call...
Oh... oh how I cry
In the lone night
Please save me from
The embrace denying my future
Where are you father?
Where are you mother?
Come from the deep,
Bless me, protect me
From her cold fingers
Echoes of terror
In this solitude
Where's my angel?
I remember your eyes (and)
How we played together
Angel...
I feel fear...
(Darkness is coming,
Watch out from your back,
Here we are...)
Why I hear but silence?
(Hunting your last breath,
Stealing your soul,
Torn apart)
Get out this cold
(Keeping the cold
Even colder
Around and inside)
Freezing my illusions
(Stalking the child
You once was,
Where is it now?)
The whisper of rain will bring me life
From an unique memory
Missing inside the twilight,
The crown of my sunrise
And moon of my paleâ€¦

My boyfriend died in an accident 2 years ago. I used to be a huge music freak . Playing music whole night in my room . Never went out without headphones. But after he died i couldn't listen to any song. Everytime i listened to something i would start thinking about our moments . I couldn't control it . It's a quite weird feeling i can't explain but it made me so uncomfortable. Eventually i stopped listening to music for some time and kinda got used to it . I was going through youtube recommendations and i found this song.. It felt so dark and refreshing. I felt free and high . Played this on repeat for hours. Started discovering new bands and new songs. I became that music freak again.
I still miss you V.â™¥
If Clan of Xymox, Depeche Mode, the Cure and New Order had a baby...
I want to live in a society only with people that feel this song

Lovely video. I'm wondering be in this beautiful place, listening this peaceful music. Some people think dark music is depressive but for me is relaxing. Very nice and cool. Congratulations Lebanon Hanover for the good work. Greets from Brazil.

I remember this song when I was 16, I loved one girl, maybe till this day, I was listening this song hoping that some day I could smile, now I'm alone, remembering her and old good times with this song, what a fool I was been, not appreciating her how it need to be, always beeing sad and melancholic, for what. Now I'm going to army for 2 years, remembering every old song and moment of my life

With your hands on your ears

That everyone can see you
